text: Langolen () is a commune in the Finistère department of Brittany in north- western France. The commune takes its name from Saint Collen, a 7th-century monk who is associated with the town of Llangollen in Wales and also with Cornwall. ==Population== Inhabitants of Langolen are called in French Langolinois. ==See also== *Communes of the Finistère department ==References== *INSEE *Mayors of Finistère Association ; ==External links== *Official website *French Ministry of Culture list for Langolen Category:Communes of Finistère
title: Langolen
